title: 51% Attack
description: A 51% attack (or majority attack) refers to a potential attack on the integrity of a blockchain system

title: Absolute Advantage
description: An economics concept in which one party has a direct advantage in efficiency in producing/providing a specific good or service over another party.

title: Active Management
description: Active management (or active investing) refers to a strategy deployed by fund managers or brokers where they trade financial assets aiming to profit from both bull and bear markets.

title: Airdrop
description: The term “Airdrop” refers to the distribution of digital assets to the public, either by virtue of holding a certain other token or simply by virtue of being an active wallet address on a particular blockchain.

title: Bear Market
description: The term bear market refers to a negative trend in the prices of a market.

title: Candidate Block
description: A candidate block is a block that a mining node (miner) is trying to mine in order to receive the block reward.
